meanings.definition: To grant a feudal estate to someone
meanings.sent1: The lord was infeoffing his loyal vassal with land.
meanings.sent2: She was infeoffing her brother with a piece of the family's property.
meanings.sent3: Infeoffing his cat with the best sleeping spot, the boy chuckled at the idea of a feline landlord.
meanings.sent4: The sun infeoffed the sky with vibrant colors as it set in the evening.
meanings.sent5: The teacher infeoffed the students with knowledge, empowering them to learn and grow.

meanings.definition: The act of investing with a feudal estate
meanings.sent1: The infeoffing of the estate was a grand ceremony attended by all villagers.
meanings.sent2: She studied the history of infeoffing to understand her family's land inheritance.
meanings.sent3: The infeoffing of the castle to the new ruler was met with cheers and celebrations.
meanings.sent4: The infeoffing of power to the council changed the dynamics of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The infeoffing of responsibilities onto the young squire marked his transition into knighthood.
